TopicTitle: What have you been the first to discover in KSP?

Articles.Content:
Have you ever discovered something new in KSP? Become the first to see an Easter Egg, awaken a new breed of Kraken, or exploit a feature for unconventional purposes? 

For instance, I was the first (as far as I know) to build a submarine that sinks using ore tanks.

Provide evidence of your discovery (pictures, post link, etc.) Tell us all how you found what you did. Was it methodical experimentation, or blind luck?

Edited March 12, 2016 by kmMango
I think I was the first but I found white lines on Minmus that extend around a 1km area and the OP I posted it on lasted for 4 pages, longer than any OP I have ever started.

Just now, HoloYolo said:

I think I was the first but I found white lines on Minmus that extend around a 1km area and the OP I posted it on lasted for 4 pages, longer than any OP I have ever started.

I'm not familiar with this. Interesting.

Can you link your post?

10 minutes ago, kmMango said:

I'm not familiar with this. Interesting.

Can you link your post?

I'll try to find it.
I discovered how to delete planets using the Klaw before Danny2462 did, but I'm not certain I was the first.

I think I may have been the first to discover that the the supposed sun tracking of the foldable radiators (pre-1.0.5) didn't actually do anything.

...which made the radiators essentially useless for cooling ships that have solar heating issues.  Turns out it was a bug, and they fixed it for 1.0.5.

Just today, I looked everywhere to see if anyone had reported something I found. The radially-attached lights have a stated power draw, and a mechanism to reduce their light output, but power draw does not reduce when you turn down the brightness. Not sure it would ever matter, but there you are
I was the first to complete the Jool-5 ISRU challenge, and I think I was one of the first to build a SSTM ISRU ship that can go pretty much anywhere in the solar system.
I invented the truss cage launching technique for larger than normal vessels.
Bugs. Lots ans lots of bugs. You're all welcome.

I may still be the only one to land an Asteroid on Kerbin using wings. I may forever be the only one, considering even I'm not dumb enough to try in the new atmo.

Well, I'm not dumb enough to try AGAIN.

Edited March 13, 2016 by 5thHorseman
One of the first or maybe the first to land a rocket on a barge in November 2014

2 hours ago, 5thHorseman said:

I may still be the only one to land an Asteroid on Kerbin using wings. I may forever be the only one, considering even I'm not dumb enough to try in the new atmo.

Well, I'm not dumb enough to try AGAIN.

No need for wings. You can throw an asteroid at the ground - I believe they either don't have a crash tolerance, or it's so ridiculously high it doesn't make any difference. Obviously post 1.0 heating is an issue, as you said. this was in 0.90

I never saw any reference to it anywhere, so I may have been the first to discover you can climb atop the eyeball of the dead kraken and plant a flag there...

And so the Monster chased them from planet to planet, and moon to moon, until Val, in an act of utter desperation, whipped out a flag pole and poked the beast in the eye, thus slaying the mighty Kraken with a pointy stick!!! 

hehehehe  

 

 

Edited March 13, 2016 by Just Jim

5th Horseman, I'll have to try this now.

Keep it up everybody! Show us your innovation.

I'm probably not the first, but I kinda pioneered using type E wings set sideways (NOT lengthwise like fins) instead of airbrakes on the back end of Eve landers to slow down and keep pointed the right way.  Crazy high heat tolerance and drag for slowing down, just have to wrap it in a fairing for Kerbin launch.
I think I discovered that 4 septatrons could make an E class astroid vanish in a poof.

I might have been the first to use the tiny finds backwards on my reentry craft to add stability. I'll have to post a pic when I get home. I'd not seen anyone else do that. Been doing it since the new aero was first introduced
I know i was the first to make a stock walker, but its not really a discovery

Im probably the first person to ever glitch out a kerbal so much that they not only get accelerated to 100 times the speed of light, but that they actually are also accelerating, even during the 100000 timewarp. After the second year Val has now gotten to 300 times the speed of light.
I think I was the first to land an asteroid at KSP.

I learned that by using timewarp and hacking gravity you can multiply gravity too.

I think I'm first.
I've done nothing first :'(

On ‎13‎.‎03‎.‎2016‎. at 11:35 AM, L3GO said:

One of the first or maybe the first to land a rocket on a barge in November 2014

Send this to SpaceX. Ask them if they need any help hahahah. Maybe Elon would hire you

On 3/12/2016 at 8:08 AM, severedsolo said:

No need for wings. You can throw an asteroid at the ground - I believe they either don't have a crash tolerance, or it's so ridiculously high it doesn't make any difference. Obviously post 1.0 heating is an issue, as you said. this was in 0.90

Oh I know. I wasn't going for "get the asteroid on the ground" though. That's boring. I was going for "Make a plane out of an asteroid."
